poem:
**The Marketplace of Memories**

In a land of keepsakes and holy spines,  
where Rudy's roast brews ambition anew,  
and Tucker's pouches breathe nicotine whispers—  
the scent of power wafts down strange aisles.  
Children gather 'round stories of gilded towers,  
while pills promise health, and T-shirts speak  
of dreams woven in the threads of nostalgia.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Trump Bibles, Rudy coffee, Tucker nicotine pouches: the rightwing knick-knack racket If you wanted to, you could smell like Donald Trump. Or you could drink coffee developed by Rudy Giuliani. You could also use a nicotine product developed by Tucker Carlson, read your children a Trump-themed book written by Mike Huckabee, take health pills hawked by Dr Oz and wear T-shirts designed by Kash Patel. These are only a few of the products that Trump". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
